question: Which of the following is the contemporary of Harsha Vardhana and defeated him on the banks of river Narmada?
explanation: Pulkeshin II was the contemporary of Harsha Vardhana and defeated him on the banks of river Narmada. Pulakesin II allied with Sasanka of Bengal and his feudatory Sainyabhitta-Madhava-Varman II of Kangoda, and with the kings of Valabhi and Bharuch. Along with all these, he was able to defeat Harsha in 637-638 AD.
